body:
For reference here is the current two kernel indicators:

![screen shot 2014-10-20 at 10 52 14 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/27600/4713727/7a3f23f8-58e6-11e4-9b93-8d815e32f7ac.png)

Also pinging @awantulok - the AnteType file for this is in the Dropbox. Feel free to iterate on that to explore the design.

Ohhhh. The green hurts my eyes. Will his be the only green element of the UI ? (except editting cell)
Would much prefer something sober. For info, look like that when other icon indicator.
![capture d ecran 2014-10-21 a 15 32 01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/335567/4719074/bfd4af56-5926-11e4-922d-398a66735879.png)

I'm afraid this will get ugly when we have notification + indicator +kernel, where you will have `button-like | icon like | button-like`
![capture d ecran 2014-10-21 a 15 40 49](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/335567/4719228/e514176a-5927-11e4-94c6-46ab00dc97bf.png)

> After using this for a while I think we should consider making the display name always and only display the underlying language (Python 2/3, Julia, R).

Which in 90% of the case will be the case, you just exclude people that might have dev kernel and want more info.

> I think we need to have a separate "project" field that describes which project has implemented this language kernel (IPython, IPython, IR). We can show this in other locations.

This can be done via kernel_info in the about screen. And anyway with custom.js and PR in progress project will be able to fill the help menu with all the link they want to the current kernel.

A few iteration on the design, no border, same background, move indicator to the left.
![capture d ecran 2014-10-21 a 15 42 17](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/335567/4719277/61d55e12-5928-11e4-9d4d-156c109e9996.png)
![capture d ecran 2014-10-21 a 15 43 02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/335567/4719278/61d79da8-5928-11e4-8b8d-ce7ff1941bd7.png)
![capture d ecran 2014-10-21 a 15 43 14](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/335567/4719280/61ec5770-5928-11e4-9f99-0aff9606225a.png)
![capture d ecran 2014-10-21 a 15 43 29](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/335567/4719279/61e8abe8-5928-11e4-8a8f-1efb0edca3ba.png)
![capture d ecran 2014-10-21 a 15 43 49](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/335567/4719282/61f4345e-5928-11e4-8d4a-4a1110c10a75.png)
![capture d ecran 2014-10-21 a 15 43 53](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/335567/4719281/61f1b86e-5928-11e4-92d6-20fd95531bf7.png)

@Carreau LOL, yes after waking up and looking at the Green I don't know what I was thinking. I guess I shouldn't do visual design work at that hour. 

Thanks a million for trying out these different things! Now I really owe you a beer. As we do UI work, I think it is super important for us to try and keep open minds and simply try different things out. Often, after looking at different options, my feelings and thoughts change.

Based on your experiments here are my current thoughts:
- I don't like the green.
- I do like having a border around the "Python 3 o" as in your first attempt as it uses a clear visual heirarchy to indicate that those things are related.
- Overall, I think the pencil icon for showing edit mode is almost useless. I would prefer a persistent "tag" style button with a capital "E" or "C".
- I like the idea of having all UI elements in the notification area have consistent sytyling as well - having some in "tag/button" styles and others not doesn't make much sense.
- I like the `o` on the right of "Python 3" and the `|` separator.

Can you create one last example with these suggestions?

> I guess I shouldn't do visual design work at that hour.

:-) 

> Thanks a million for trying out these different things!

Live html editing in chrome inspector, not that hard. 

> I don't like the green.

Agreed,

> I do like having a border around the "Python 3 o" as in your first attempt as it uses a clear visual heirarchy to indicate that those things are related.

I don't feel like a button, it is not, but I wont' kill myself if there is.

> Overall, I think the pencil icon for showing edit mode is almost useless. I would prefer a persistent "tag" style button with a capital "E" or "C".

That css-ifiable I gess with a ':before`. (Is it even a verb ? )

> I like the idea of having all UI elements in the notification area have consistent sytyling as well - having some in "tag/button" styles and others not doesn't make much sense.

I think 2 style are fine as long as they do not alternate. There is a clear difference between icon that are  status - like, and button are really message-like.

> I like the o on the right of "Python 3" and the | separator.

I prefer the O on the left, but I like the `|` too.
